verses.text_plain: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
verses.verse_html:
1Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down? ▼
▼ leviathan: probably an extinct animal of some kind
 , ▼
▼ which…: Heb. which thou drownest?

tokens.text: probably an extinct animal of some kind

footnotes.body_text: ▼ leviathan: probably an extinct animal of some kind
footnotes.body_html: ▼ leviathan: probably an extinct animal of some kind
▼ which…: Heb. which thou drownest?

verses.text_plain: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
verses.verse_html: 2Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

verses.text_plain: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?
verses.verse_html: 3Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

verses.text_plain: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
verses.verse_html: 4Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

verses.text_plain: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
verses.verse_html: 5Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

verses.text_plain: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
verses.verse_html: 6Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

verses.text_plain: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
verses.verse_html: 7Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

verses.text_plain: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
verses.verse_html: 8Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

verses.text_plain: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
verses.verse_html: 9Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

verses.text_plain: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
verses.verse_html: 10None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

tokens.text: who then is able to stand

verses.text_plain: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
verses.verse_html: 11Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

verses.text_plain: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
verses.verse_html: 12I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

verses.text_plain: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
verses.verse_html:
13Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle? ▼
▼ with: or, within

verses.text_plain: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
verses.verse_html: 14Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

verses.text_plain: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
verses.verse_html:
15His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal. ▼
▼ scales: Heb. strong pieces of shields

footnotes.body_text: ▼ scales: Heb. strong pieces of shields
footnotes.body_html: ▼ scales: Heb. strong pieces of shields

verses.text_plain: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
verses.verse_html: 16One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

verses.text_plain: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
verses.verse_html: 17They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

verses.text_plain: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
verses.verse_html: 18By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

verses.text_plain: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
verses.verse_html: 19Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

verses.text_plain: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
verses.verse_html: 20Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

verses.text_plain: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
verses.verse_html: 21His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

verses.text_plain: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
verses.verse_html:
22In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him. ▼
▼ is turned into joy: Heb. rejoiceth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is turned into joy: Heb. rejoiceth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is turned into joy: Heb. rejoiceth

verses.text_plain: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
verses.verse_html:
23The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved. ▼
▼ flakes: Heb. fallings

tokens.text: in themselves; they cannot be moved

verses.text_plain: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
verses.verse_html: 24His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

verses.text_plain: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
verses.verse_html: 25When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

verses.text_plain: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
verses.verse_html:
26The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon. ▼
▼ habergeon: or, breastplate

verses.text_plain: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
verses.verse_html: 27He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

verses.text_plain: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
verses.verse_html: 28The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

verses.text_plain: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
verses.verse_html: 29Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

verses.text_plain: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
verses.verse_html:
30Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire. ▼
▼ Sharp stones: Heb. Sharp pieces of potsherd

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Sharp stones: Heb. Sharp pieces of potsherd
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Sharp stones: Heb. Sharp pieces of potsherd

verses.text_plain: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.verse_html: 31He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

verses.text_plain: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
verses.verse_html: 32He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

verses.text_plain: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
verses.verse_html:
33Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear. ▼
▼ is made without fear: or, behave themselves without fear

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is made without fear: or, behave themselves without fear
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is made without fear: or, behave themselves without fear

verses.text_plain: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
verses.verse_html: 34He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
